intro: Cheiranthus californicus, commonly known as the California wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and foothills. It produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers with four petals, and its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy. The species is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, arid environments.
